results.title: The Counselling approach
results.creator_credit: Concord Films Council and Phil Swerdlow
results.brief_description: Counselling plays an important part in helping a pregnant woman face an abortion. There is a need for the woman to discuss her reactions to the situation and the decisions she makes concerning this. The work of counsellors in this area is highlighted.

results.title: The Coulomb force constant
results.creator_credit: Educational Services, Inc. and Richard Leacock
results.brief_description: Eric M. Rogers shows a large scale version of the Millikan experiment by which the value of the Coulomb force constant can be determined. Shows a large scale version of the Millikan experiment. The small charged plates of the original experiment are made very large and the effects are show of increasing plate area and separation and adding more batteries to charge the plates. The same electric field strength used in the Millikan experiment enables the experimenter to count the number of elementary charges on an object and measure the constant in Coulomb’s law of electric forces.

results.title: The Cottonseed
results.brief_description: Set in the northern plains of Nigeria the film shows the main stages in the growth of cotton, and gives a glimpse of the cotton ginning process, before ending with an account of the uses of the oilseed crop.

results.title: The Costume designer
results.brief_description: Explains the work of costume designers in the production of a feature motion picture. The costume designer must create - whether for one star or a mob scene - costumes that are appropriate - historically, geographically and, most important, dramatically. The designer must have each design, plus the cost breakdown, approved by the director, producer, and art director. To make any improvements needed, the costume designer stays on the set until production ends.

Episode of Series “Focus”.

results.title: The Cosmic link [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Eric Michel and Catherine Fol
results.brief_description: This award-winning documentary explores the age-old question of “life” - where do we come from, is there life on other planets, how did life begin? Planet Earth has only one life form: all life on Earth shares some of the same genetic code and has developed from the same evolutionary tree. It is recognised that humans and apes share 98% of the same DNA. But could life have evolved differently out there in the cosmos? Astrophysicists, geologists, biochemists, astronomers, and biopalaeontologists discuss their theories and discoveries, both on Earth and in space, to help shed some light on this mystery of life. Uses microphotography, 3D animation and some excellent cinematography to provide a visual spectacle to what has always been a fascinating subject for discussion. Narrated by Lynne Adams. In English and French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Corporation
results.creator_credit: Big Picture Media Corporation, Mark Achbar, Bart Simpson and Jennifer Abbott
results.brief_description: Entertaining, illuminating and exhaustively researched Canadian documentary about the rise in power and stature of corporations, and the impact felt throughout the world. Many topics are examined over the course of this work including exploitation of developing countries, company fraud, environmental impact of business on the natural world, business ethics, corporate espionage, media power, censorship, globalisation, marketing manipulation, privatisation and protests. Featuring a wide array of interviews, witty graphics and a soothing voice-over, the filmmakers succeed in making the complexities of the issues at play here understood whilst enrapturing the audience. Winner of the Best Documentary World Cinema Audience Award at the 2004 Sundance Film Festival. Interviewees include: Naomi Klein, Michael Moore and Noam Chomsky.

results.title: The Coronation of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth the Second 2nd June 1953
results.brief_description: A highlight compilation of Queen Elizabeth’s coronation on the 2nd of June 1953. Commences with Queen Elizabeth’s journey through London and her arrival at Westminster Abbey. Shows her entrance to the Abbey, and highlights of the coronation service including receiving the ‘ord’ and being ‘crowned’. Follows the procession back to Buckingham Palace and the Queen and her family greeting her ‘subjects’ from the palace balcony. Finally, the flight of jet fighters over Buckingham Palace completes the occasion.

results.title: The Coronation
results.brief_description: Covers the main features of the 1953 coronation ceremony. Shows Queen Elizabeth travelling to Westminster Abbey in the State Coach; the service inside the Abbey; the actual crowning; and the Duke of Edinburgh’s declaration of allegiance; the procession back to Buckingham Palace; the appearance of the Royal Family on the Palace balcony. Includes short footage of Sir Robert Menzies at Westminster Abbey. Presented by Gordon Craig, commentary by Leslie Mitchell, script by Cecil Burge, edited by Gerald Sanger.
